channel.itunes:author: The Barn Vineyard
channel.description: We are a community committed to following Jesus who deeply experience the love and presence of God by his Spirit. We believe our faith in Jesus is best experienced with others, should promote life-change to be more like Him, and should empower us to use our gifts to love and serve the people around us both locally and abroad.

item.itunes:title: Waiting on God - Thomas Shaffstall

item.itunes:title: The Resurrection of Jesus: God's Receipt, Our Power - Bruce Latshaw
item.title: The Resurrection of Jesus: God's Receipt, Our Power - Bruce Latshaw
item.itunes:summary: We celebrate Good Friday because on the Cross Jesus bore our sins in His own body. He suffered the punishment and death due to all human beings. His passion satisfied our immeasurable debt to the Father that we could never have paid. Jesus paid it all and set us forever free. So what was the resurrection? Pastor Bruce Latshaw will give us insight into what the resurrection of Jesus was in the eyes of God and the watching universe, and what that pivotal point in divine history did for us, His ...
item.description: We celebrate Good Friday because on the Cross Jesus bore our sins in His own body. He suffered the punishment and death due to all human beings. His passion satisfied our immeasurable debt to the Father that we could never have paid. Jesus paid it all and set us forever free. So what was the resurrection? Pastor Bruce Latshaw will give us insight into what the resurrection of Jesus was in the eyes of God and the watching universe, and what that pivotal point in divine history did for us, His kingdom people, forever.
item.content:encoded: We celebrate Good Friday because on the Cross Jesus bore our sins in His own body. He suffered the punishment and death due to all human beings. His passion satisfied our immeasurable debt to the Father that we could never have paid. Jesus paid it all and set us forever free. So what was the resurrection? Pastor Bruce Latshaw will give us insight into what the resurrection of Jesus was in the eyes of God and the watching universe, and what that pivotal point in divine history did for us, His kingdom people, forever.
item.itunes:author: The Barn Vineyard/Bruce Latshaw

item.itunes:title: And He Appeared to Many
item.title: And He Appeared to Many
item.itunes:summary: The many visible appearances of the risen Jesus are part of the essential gospel message. The evidence of scripture shows that most of the disciples did not believe He had risen until they literally saw and even touched Him as He appeared to them in His new body. We will explore this great gospel reality and its relevance to our daily lives as we walk out being radical followers of our Lord.

item.itunes:summary: We all face trials and adversities in our lives. At times we may wonder, âWhere are you, God? We will find that God was in the business then and is in the business now of releasing His power in the midst of human challenges, making a way where there is no wa...
item.description:
We all face trials and adversities in our lives. At times we may wonder, âWhere are you, God? What are you doing?â But our trials are often exactly the place where we encounter the living God, who shows Himself strong on our behalf. In this teaching we will look at the âfieryâ trial of three young Jewish men in the book of Daniel. We will find that God was in the business then and is in the business now of releasing His power in the midst of human challenges, making a way where there is no way.

Teaching Notes: https://thebarnvineyard-teaching-material.s3.amazonaws.com/Encountering+God%2C+Gritty+Faith+-+Daniel.pdf

item.itunes:title: Kingdom Life: God, Us and Money
item.title: Kingdom Life: God, Us and Money
item.itunes:summary: This teaching explores Godâs loving heart towards us concerning finances. He understands our needs and concerns and promises to supply resources to us so that we will have enough for every good work. He also understands the dangers of money and has a plan to help us step into the right relationship with money. That plan is Giving. He is after our heart, not our money!

item.itunes:title: Key to Blessed Living in God's Kingdom: The Golden Rule
item.title: Key to Blessed Living in God's Kingdom: The Golden Rule
item.itunes:summary: In this teaching Bruce continues the series on "The Walk" in God's kingdom. The "key" to blessing he examines this week is Jesus' "golden" rule to "treat others as you want to be treated." He discusses the origin of this "rule" from Scripture, its expression in other religions, and how what Jesus said is the highest and most transforming expression of this powerful life truth!

item.description: In this teaching Bruce uses the examples of Jesus and Philip as mature New Testament evangelists--the "kerux"--the announcer of good news in Ephesians 4:11. He describes the differences between being a "witness" and being an "evangelist," one the five gifts of leader/equippers Jesus has given to the church. He also lists the characteristics of the NT evangelist's ministry, which consists of both the "announcement" (declaration/preaching) of the the divine King and his kingdom, and the "demonstration" of Jesus' power through signs and wonders. He ends by calling the emerging evangelists at The Barn forward for authorization and activation.

item.itunes:title: The Kingdom Law of "Flow"
item.title: The Kingdom Law of "Flow"
item.itunes:summary: In this teaching Bruce unpacks the "giving" and "receiving" parts of Jesus' words, 'It is more blessed to give than to receive." He discusses what he calls the "law of flow"--that everything created, if alive, gives out and receives back as a primary dynamic of life. He counsels us to align ourselves with God's law by understanding and partaking in the giving and receiving of God's life in three areas: use of God's gifts in ministry, use of Scripture in prayer, and use of our resources. He no...
item.description: In this teaching Bruce unpacks the "giving" and "receiving" parts of Jesus' words, 'It is more blessed to give than to receive." He discusses what he calls the "law of flow"--that everything created, if alive, gives out and receives back as a primary dynamic of life. He counsels us to align ourselves with God's law by understanding and partaking in the giving and receiving of God's life in three areas: use of God's gifts in ministry, use of Scripture in prayer, and use of our resources. He notes that without participating in this "flow" through both giving and receiving, no Christian will be satisfied with any church, no matter how excellent the church, because receiving God's life flows from giving it away. He also touches on a challenge many of us have: wanting to be givers but not receivers, and how that problem can block the flow of God's life and resources into and through us.
item.content:encoded: In this teaching Bruce unpacks the "giving" and "receiving" parts of Jesus' words, 'It is more blessed to give than to receive." He discusses what he calls the "law of flow"--that everything created, if alive, gives out and receives back as a primary dynamic of life. He counsels us to align ourselves with God's law by understanding and partaking in the giving and receiving of God's life in three areas: use of God's gifts in ministry, use of Scripture in prayer, and use of our resources. He notes that without participating in this "flow" through both giving and receiving, no Christian will be satisfied with any church, no matter how excellent the church, because receiving God's life flows from giving it away. He also touches on a challenge many of us have: wanting to be givers but not receivers, and how that problem can block the flow of God's life and resources into and through us.

item.itunes:title: The Spirit's Original Church
item.title: The Spirit's Original Church
item.itunes:summary: In this teaching Bruce reviews the "wineskin" of the church as it appeared in its first three centuries based on scriptures and the writings of church fathers. Then he details the changes instituted by Constantine at the Council of Nicea in 325 and their legacy in the Western church today. Bruce advocates a return by The Barn to the wineskin principles that governed the early "apostolic" church.

item.itunes:title: Casualties of War
item.title: Casualties of War
item.itunes:summary: In this teaching, Bruce talks about the perspective taught by the Bible when Christians encounter life situations in which God does not act to reverse the power of evil. Examining texts on the kingdom of God, we see that while the kingdom (the manifest reign and rule of God) has come and is "here" in the presence of the power of the Spirit of Christ, the fullness of God's kingdom is not yet here. Therefore, while Jesus has won the war, sometimes spiritual battles are lost to the enemy, as spe...
item.description: In this teaching, Bruce talks about the perspective taught by the Bible when Christians encounter life situations in which God does not act to reverse the power of evil. Examining texts on the kingdom of God, we see that while the kingdom (the manifest reign and rule of God) has come and is "here" in the presence of the power of the Spirit of Christ, the fullness of God's kingdom is not yet here. Therefore, while Jesus has won the war, sometimes spiritual battles are lost to the enemy, as specific events in the New Testament show. This is "biblical reality" that helps explain why some are healed by God and some are not, even as Paul tells us that our "seeing" in prophecy is partial now, but will be complete when the "perfect" (the coming of Jesus and His kingdom) comes. Yet, Romans 8:28 remains true for the believer, as God miraculously works even enemy victories for "good" by His creative, redemptive grace.
item.content:encoded: In this teaching, Bruce talks about the perspective taught by the Bible when Christians encounter life situations in which God does not act to reverse the power of evil. Examining texts on the kingdom of God, we see that while the kingdom (the manifest reign and rule of God) has come and is "here" in the presence of the power of the Spirit of Christ, the fullness of God's kingdom is not yet here. Therefore, while Jesus has won the war, sometimes spiritual battles are lost to the enemy, as specific events in the New Testament show. This is "biblical reality" that helps explain why some are healed by God and some are not, even as Paul tells us that our "seeing" in prophecy is partial now, but will be complete when the "perfect" (the coming of Jesus and His kingdom) comes. Yet, Romans 8:28 remains true for the believer, as God miraculously works even enemy victories for "good" by His creative, redemptive grace.

item.title: The Overlooked Power of Greeting One Another
item.itunes:summary: In this teaching, Bruce starts a series of the dynamics of the early church--what made it healthy and dynamic, able to turn the world upside down in a generation. He will compare this God-birthed church with the church today and the re-formed Barn Vineyard in 2017 and beyond. Today Bruce teaches on the overlooked power of Christians greeting one another and Jesus' words to greet even those we don't know. He shows how there is an external side to greeting and an internal, spiritual side to gre...
item.description: In this teaching, Bruce starts a series of the dynamics of the early church--what made it healthy and dynamic, able to turn the world upside down in a generation. He will compare this God-birthed church with the church today and the re-formed Barn Vineyard in 2017 and beyond. Today Bruce teaches on the overlooked power of Christians greeting one another and Jesus' words to greet even those we don't know. He shows how there is an external side to greeting and an internal, spiritual side to greeting--and how the spiritual atmosphere of a church gathering can be strongly affected by whether or not greeting truly happens among those present. A link to a written version of this teaching is available below as well if desired.
item.content:encoded: In this teaching, Bruce starts a series of the dynamics of the early church--what made it healthy and dynamic, able to turn the world upside down in a generation. He will compare this God-birthed church with the church today and the re-formed Barn Vineyard in 2017 and beyond. Today Bruce teaches on the overlooked power of Christians greeting one another and Jesus' words to greet even those we don't know. He shows how there is an external side to greeting and an internal, spiritual side to greeting--and how the spiritual atmosphere of a church gathering can be strongly affected by whether or not greeting truly happens among those present. A link to a written version of this teaching is available below as well if desired.

item.itunes:title: The Post-Resurrection Appearances of Jesus: You Gotta Believe!
item.title: The Post-Resurrection Appearances of Jesus: You Gotta Believe!
item.itunes:summary: In this teaching, Bruce shows how the appearances of Jesus after his resurrection form the "many infallible proofs" that Jesus was the Messiah. The unique nature of His "spiritual" body marked the emergence of a new "form" of humanity on the earth. Then Bruce discusses seven characteristics of Jesus' resurrection body that will also be ours when we, the redeemed, receive ours at the coming of the Lord.

item.itunes:summary: Bruce Latshaw describes how radical Jesus' ministry methods were in contrast to the Jewish exorcists and healers of his day. Bruce then links Jesus' use of divine authority to deliver and heal to the church's authority to do the same, in the same way. Bruce stresses that we would be wise to use biblical ways of mi...
item.description: Bruce Latshaw describes how radical Jesus' ministry methods were in contrast to the Jewish exorcists and healers of his day. Jesus' ability to "cast out spirits with a word" and to bring healing to the diseased in the same way prompted onlookers to be amazed at the "authority" and "power" He demonstrated. Bruce then links Jesus' use of divine authority to deliver and heal to the church's authority to do the same, in the same way. Bruce stresses that we would be wise to use biblical ways of ministry to produce biblical results of ministry.
item.content:encoded: Bruce Latshaw describes how radical Jesus' ministry methods were in contrast to the Jewish exorcists and healers of his day. Bruce then links Jesus' use of divine authority to deliver and heal to the church's authority to do the same, in the same way. Bruce stresses that we would be wise to use biblical ways of ministry to produce biblical results of ministry.

item.itunes:title: His Identity and Ours in Him
item.title: His Identity and Ours in Him
item.itunes:summary: In this kickoff of a new series on the radical Jesus, Bruce focuses on the "hypostatic union" of the Christ--his dual nature as fully God and fully man in one Person. Bruce explains why he had to be both in order for redeemed humanity to receive salvation. In particular he describes "The Great Exchange" -- Jesus "partook" of our humanity (Hebrews 2:14) so that we could "partake" of his divine nature (1 Peter 1:4) -- and how we got the much better part of that deal!

item.itunes:title: Remember God's Word
item.title: Remember God's Word
item.itunes:summary: Jesus said that we do not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of God. Really? Do we really live like that? Do we depend on God's word like we depend on food? Do we seek it out? Do we rely on it for life and nourishment? Let's be challenged to remember the great power of God's word in our lives!

item.itunes:title: Transforming Lives - Part 1
item.title: Transforming Lives - Part 1
item.itunes:summary: In this teaching Bruce explore the third part of The Barn Vineyard vision, "transforming lives." Beginning with the biblical meaning of "transform," this vital discipleship concept is presented from the standpoint of the dramatic origin point of Paul's transformation: his Damascus road encounter with the risen Jesus. Bruce locates the start, progress in, and end point of our spiritual transformation where the Scripture says it is in 2 Co. 3:18, through "beholding" the glory of God in the face...
item.description: In this teaching Bruce explore the third part of The Barn Vineyard vision, "transforming lives." Beginning with the biblical meaning of "transform," this vital discipleship concept is presented from the standpoint of the dramatic origin point of Paul's transformation: his Damascus road encounter with the risen Jesus. Bruce locates the start, progress in, and end point of our spiritual transformation where the Scripture says it is in 2 Co. 3:18, through "beholding" the glory of God in the face of Jesus, just as Paul discovered on that Damascus Road. Next week Bruce shows how the transformation that begins with individuals flows outward, eventually to flood the planet with a transformed humanity!

item.itunes:summary: Jesus promises many amazing things about himself. But sometimes our insistence in wanting everything in our timing and in our way can stand in the way of us really experiencing his promises. From the story of Lazarus, we discuss four ways to learn to trust Him more.

item.itunes:title: Quenching the Holy Spirit: What It Is & How Not To Do It
item.title: Quenching the Holy Spirit: What It Is & How Not To Do It
item.itunes:summary: In this teaching on the series on our relationship to the Holy Spirit, Bruce examines 1 Thess. 5:19-22. There Paul tells the church not to quench the Spirit and explains how not to do so. Three key words are highlighted from this passage: quench, despise, and examine. How they three concepts inter-relate provides understanding of Paul is saying when he commands the Christians not to "quench" the Holy Spirit.

item.itunes:title: Three Keys to Answered Prayer (cont)
item.title: Three Keys to Answered Prayer (cont)
item.itunes:summary: In this teaching Bruce reviews the first two of three key principles of "effectual" prayer. Then he unpacks "perseverance," the third key by explaining the difference between prayer that is "one asking and then thanking" versus prayer that is multiple asking, seeking, and knocking for the same strategic prayer goals. Luke 11 and 18 are used plus the example of Elijah in 1 Kings 17 and 18 is noted as biblical instances of both kinds of praying.

item.itunes:title: Demystifying Revival Part 2
item.title: Demystifying Revival Part 2
item.itunes:summary: In this teaching, Bruce offers his belief that this season of time is a "kairos" moment when God is beginning to release a third great awakening in America, and an outpouring of His Spirit worldwide. He explores the biblical meaning of the terms revival, renewal, and awakening, lists some major catalysts of revival, and offers suggestions as to how The Barn Vineyard can prepare ourselves to be part of this next revival season.

item.itunes:title: Serving God From Passion
item.title: Serving God From Passion
item.itunes:summary: God has given every person who believes in Jesus a gift to be used to bless others. And when we use that gift, it brings us life and blesses others. How wonderful a church would be where everyone is using their gift, full of life and passion rather than doing service out of obligation or guilt. This teaching gives a foundation on how to discover the service or work God has planned for you.

item.itunes:title: God Is In A Good Mood
item.title: God Is In A Good Mood
item.itunes:summary: This teaching is based on the Firestarters curriculum from Bethel Church. Today's teaching covers four topics: God is always good, God in in a good mood towards us, God wants us to experience His good mood, and God wants to release His good mood through us.

item.itunes:title: Who Are You Really? Your Identity in Christ
item.title: Who Are You Really? Your Identity in Christ
item.itunes:summary: In this "wild card" teaching, Bruce focuses on 2 Co. 5:17-"Anyone who is in Christ is a new creation. Old things have passed away, brand new things have come!" as the lynchpin of the transformation from our old "natural" self, shaped by this world, into our new "spiritual" self, created in the image of Jesus. All of the "new creation" began at the resurrection of Christ, including our "new person." Our old "man" separated from God, hostile to humanity and devoted to pleasing self, was dealt ...
item.description: In this "wild card" teaching, Bruce focuses on 2 Co. 5:17-"Anyone who is in Christ is a new creation. Old things have passed away, brand new things have come!" as the lynchpin of the transformation from our old "natural" self, shaped by this world, into our new "spiritual" self, created in the image of Jesus. All of the "new creation" began at the resurrection of Christ, including our "new person." Our old "man" separated from God, hostile to humanity and devoted to pleasing self, was dealt a death blow by the power of the Cross, so that we may live no longer as enemies of God. Instead our new identity includes acceptance replacing rejection, security vs. fear, inclusion vs. exclusion, favor vs. wrath, blessing vs. a curse. As we know and declare the reality of this new identity in Christ in us, we grow from glory to glory into its complete fulfillment.
item.content:encoded: In this "wild card" teaching, Bruce focuses on 2 Co. 5:17-"Anyone who is in Christ is a new creation. Old things have passed away, brand new things have come!" as the lynchpin of the transformation from our old "natural" self, shaped by this world, into our new "spiritual" self, created in the image of Jesus. All of the "new creation" began at the resurrection of Christ, including our "new person." Our old "man" separated from God, hostile to humanity and devoted to pleasing self, was dealt a death blow by the power of the Cross, so that we may live no longer as enemies of God. Instead our new identity includes acceptance replacing rejection, security vs. fear, inclusion vs. exclusion, favor vs. wrath, blessing vs. a curse. As we know and declare the reality of this new identity in Christ in us, we grow from glory to glory into its complete fulfillment.

item.itunes:title: Why Am I Doing This?
item.title: Why Am I Doing This?
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever had a day at work where you just thought, "Why am I doing this?" Have you ever felt burned out or overwhelmed with work you have in your life that doesn't seem to bring you much life? Christian explores the encouragement of 1 Thess 1:3, and the powerful link between faith, hope, love in all that we do.

item.itunes:title: The Healing of Peter: The Healing of Us
item.title: The Healing of Peter: The Healing of Us
item.itunes:summary: This teaching traces the resurrected Jesus as He brings restoration and inner healing to Peter. In Peter's three declarations of his love for the Lord, we find a key to healing His followers today who have experienced sin and personal failure.

item.itunes:title: Rise: Rejoice! The Risen Jesus is Reaching Out to You!
item.title: Rise: Rejoice! The Risen Jesus is Reaching Out to You!
item.itunes:summary: One of the great stories of God's rescuing of humanity, is that he came to us. He reached out to us in our sorrow, pain, and sin. This Easter we look at four stories from the resurrection accounts, where Jesus pursued people where they were - and brought them the gift of resurrection life!

item.title: Palm Sunday:Great Expectations

item.title: Live Like Jesus Did
item.itunes:summary: As we continue our discussion of the book of 1 John, Christian challenges us that living in the light should be evidenced with how we actually live our lives! The fruit of our relationship with Jesus should be a renewed and transformed life!

item.itunes:title: The Christian and Government
item.title: The Christian and Government
item.itunes:summary: Bruce unpacks Ro. 13:1-7 where Paul instructs Roman Christians about their relationship to God and governing authorities. Bruce discusses the text, context, and related biblical truth to present a balanced set of practical conclusions for Christians in our contemporary world.

item.itunes:title: Sincere Love
item.title: Sincere Love
item.itunes:summary: There are many different definitions of love in our society. Paul in Romans 12:9-21 tells us what sincere love is. Love is not a warm, fuzzy feeling but an action. These verses will help us understand God's concept of love.

item.itunes:title: No Longer Slaves
item.title: No Longer Slaves
item.itunes:summary: John opens us up to the fullness of who God is and shows us that because we have access to all of this through Jesus, we no longer have to settle and contend with darkness and the stuff that doesn't align with who God is in our lives. We simply have to commit to continually coming to him - honestly - fully exposing who we really are, coming into agreement with Gods thoughts on the darkness in our life so that in that place of confession, God's light can transform our darkness.

item.itunes:title: God is a Finisher, Are You?
item.title: God is a Finisher, Are You?
item.itunes:summary: God promises to finish what he starts. Often in life, even with our best intentions, we don't follow through on the dreams and visions that God puts in our heart. Tonight, a panel of people from the church shares personal and biblical insight into how to be a finisher!
